entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 3:08PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORM FORCE LOWS FOR WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska will bring a storm force front to the panhandle tomorrow. This system will bring increased winds along the outer coast. Wind gusts could range from 45 to 55 mph. Forecast guidance today continues to show a strong front impacting the area Wednesday morning to Thursday morning. As

entry.summary: ...PM-10 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR THE YUMA AREA WEDNESDAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 4:53AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Difficult travel likely over Kings Hill Pass this morning... The snow has mostly moved out of the Little Belt Mountains early this morning, but it has likely left behind snow covered and icy roads over Kings Hill Pass. If you need to travel over the pass this morning, make sure to take it slow, and be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Little Belt and Highwood Mountains
